info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:39AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN MONROE...SOUTHEASTERN BELMONT...OHIO...NORTHERN WETZEL AND MARSHALL COUNTIES THROUGH 530 AM EDT... At 439 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Woodsfield to near Sistersville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Wheeling, Moundsville, New Martinsville, Bellaire, Bethlehem, Woodsfield, Shadyside, Paden City, McMechen, Powhatan Point, Glen Dale, Bridgeport, Benwood, Sardis, Beallsville, Clarington, Neffs, Jerusalem, Wilson, and Cameron. This includes Interstate 70 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
